title: Particle motion - analysis of speed from velocity

content.question: A particle moves along a straight line. The graph of the particle’s velocity <math> <mrow> <mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> </math> at time t is shown above for <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>m</mi> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> </math> where j, k, l, and m are constants. The graph intersects the horizontal axis at <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> </math> <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>k</mi> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>m</mi> </mrow> </math> and has horizontal tangents at <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>j</mi></mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>l</mi> </mrow> </math>. For what values of t is the speed of the particle decreasing?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
